Joe Ray (2004âpresent)
Alana Watson (2008âpresent) | past_members = }} '''Nero''' are an electronic music act from [[London]], [[England]] consisting of Daniel Stephens and Joe Ray.{{Cite web |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2010/dec/13/new-band-nero |title=New band of the day â No 929: Nero |accessdate=01 December 2011}} [[Alana Watson]] provides vocals on many of the duo's songs, though she is not officially a band member. On 6 December 2010, Nero were announced as nominees for the [[BBC]]'s ''[[Sound of...|Sound of 2011]]'' poll. ==History== Nero are electronic music artists, best known for producing [[drum and bass]], [[dubstep]] and [[House music|house]]. Nero's debut release was "Space 2001" as part of the "Straight Outta Leicester" three piece vinyl LP on Reformed Recordings in 2004. Nero's debut dubstep release was "This Way" in 2008. They won the 2010 [[Beatport]] awards for Best Dubstep Act and Best Dubstep Track for "Act Like You Know". Nero recently released their first album, named ''[[Welcome Reality]]'' (after the "Me & You" B-side), signed to MTA Records, owned by [[Chase & Status]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.threesixzerogroup.com/artiste.cfm?theArtisteID=D2AD71F2-15C5-F4C0-99310D2AA91E09C4 |title=Three Six Zero Group: Artist Management |accessdate=01 December 2011}} [[Sasha Frere-Jones]], journalist for the ''[[New Yorker Magazine]]'', listed Nero's [[remix]] of [[The Streets]], "Blinded by the Lights" in his top songs of 2009.{{Cite web |url=http://www.newyorker.com/online/blogs/sashafrerejones/2009/12/the-best-recordings-of-2009-annotated-version.html#ixzz160qfqDUd |title=Sasha Frere-Jones: The Best Recordings of 2009: Annotated Version |author=The New Yorker |accessdate=01 December 2011}} The track had radio airplay in the UK as well as being played by DJs including [[Chase & Status]], [[Skream]], [[TiÃ«sto]] and [[Diplo (DJ)|Diplo]].{{cn|date=December 2011}} More recently Nero have remixed [[La Roux]], [[deadmau5]] and [[N*E*R*D]].{{cn|date=December 2011}} ===''Welcome Reality'' (2010âpresent)=== [[File:NEROcampbiscox.jpg|thumb|left|NERO performing at Camp Bisco X in [[Mariaville Lake, New York]] on July 9, 2011.]] The duo released their first official single "[[Innocence (Nero Song)|Innocence]]" in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2010. The single was released as a double A-side with the track "Electron" as a [[music download|digital download]], as well as on [[gramophone record|vinyl]]. The track peaked at number 167 on the [[UK Singles Chart]] besides peaking at number 16 and 11 on the [[UK Dance Chart|Dance]] and [[UK Indie Chart|Independent]] charts. On 6 December 2010, Nero were nominated for the BBC's [[Sound of... (BBC poll)|Sound of 2011]] poll.{{Cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/soundof/2011/artists/nero/ |title=Sound of 2011 - Nero |author=BBC |accessdate="01 December 2011}} The nomination was followed by the addition of their second official single "[[Me & You (Nero song)|Me & You]]" to [[BBC Radio 1]]'s A List playlist on 8 December 2010.{{cn|date=December 2011}} The single was released in the UK as both a digital download and a 12" vinyl on 2 January 2011, where it debuted at number 15 on the singles chart, also managing to reach the number one spot on the independent releases chart.{{cn|date=December 2011}} The duo's third single, "[[Guilt (Nero song)|Guilt]]" made its premiere when [[Zane Lowe]] selected it as his ''Hottest Record in the World'' on 22 February.{{Cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/zanelowe/2011/02/hottest_record_-_nero_-_guilt.html/ |title=Hottest Record in the World - 22 February 2011 |author=BBC |accessdate=01 December 2011}} Having been released on 24 April, "Guilt" debuted at number 8 in the UK. The London duo's debut album ''[[Welcome Reality (Album)|Welcome Reality]]'' was released on 15 August 2011 and features tracks "Innocence", "Me & You", "Guilt" and "[[Promises (Nero song)|Promises]]". The latter track, "Promises" made its debut on 17 May when Zane Lowe named it ''Hottest Record in the World'' - the third consecutive single from the duo to achieve this feat. On 14 August 2011, "Promises" debuted at number 1 in the UK singles chart. Their debut album entitled "Welcome Reality" was released on 15 August 2011 and debuted at number 1 in the UK album chart. They also produced [[Example (rapper)|Example's]] single "[[Stay Awake (song)|Stay Awake]]" which also topped the charts in 2011. The duo will also be touring their live show this coming Autumn in both the UK and US.{{Cite web |url=http://www.thisisnero.com/nero-announce-their-first-live-show-and-confirm-tinie-tempah-support |title=Nero announce their first live show and confirm Tinie Tempah support |accessdate=01 December 2011}} ===''Additional works''=== *Nero composed an orchestral piece known as [http://www.wimp.com/dubstepsymphony/ the dubstep symphony] (later officially titled 'Symphony 2808'), performed by the BBC Philharmonic Orchestra on BBC Radio 1 on 6 June 2011{{cite web|title=BBC Philharmonic|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/orchestras/events/724|accessdate=01 December 2011}} ==Discography== {{Main|Nero discography}} * ''[[Welcome Reality]]'' (2011) ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{myspace|nerouk|Nero}} *{{facebook|nerouk|Nero}} *{{twitter|nerouk|Nero}} *{{YouTube|u=NeroOfficial|Nero}} *{{discogs artist|Nero (5)|Nero}} {{Nero}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nero (Musicians)}} [[Category:Electronic music duos]] [[Category:English electronic music groups]] [[Category:Dubstep music groups]] [[de:Nero (Band)]] [[fr:Nero (musique)]] [[he:Nero (×¦×× ×××××§××)]] [[nl:Nero (band)]] [[ru:Nero (Ð³ÑÑÐ¿Ð¿Ð°)]] [[sk:Nero (hudobnÃ¡ skupina)]]
